title: To amend the Indian Financing Act of 1974 to improve the effectiveness of the Indian loan guarantee and insurance program.
content: Indian Financing Act Reform Amendment - Amends the Indian Financing Act of 1974 to increase from $100,000 to $250,000 the amount of Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) insured loans a lender can offer to a borrower. Permits the transfer of insured or guaranteed loans made under such Act. Requires that the Secretary of the Interior be notified of such transfers. Continues the lender's obligation on the guarantee or insurance agreement, responsibility for servicing, and status as the secured creditor of record notwithstanding any transfer. Pledges the full faith and credit of the United States behind loan guarantees and loan insurance made under this Act. Authorizes the Secretary to recover damages from a lender for material breach of obligations under a guaranteed or insured loan.
